intro: Lampranthus suavissimus, commonly known as the sweetface or rainbow bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces vibrant, showy flowers in shades of red, yellow, and orange, often appearing in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its ability to store water in its leaves allows it to survive in arid conditions, adapting well to dry climates.
